doDDfFHatezeImFKLQNBMA.text: Great food, atmosphere too. We had group of 6 people at dinner. The new owner stopped by our table ( I knew him from the time when he was a manager / cook..) and said that they had a grand opening last night. He welcomes us with small Cosmo drinks. Then he brought the whole plate of the  appetizers. We had great dinner ( lamb, chicken,salad). Everything you order is great quality. Place is unbelievably clean.  Every  surface is shinny( it was always like that and it's very refreshing to see)  Thank you for great time

d25yiWC1Hi80tALOY2hcIw.text: What a find off I79!   Great food, great service.   So glad to have found this delightful stop.

SyxE02TDAy79IBxEi-GSuw.text: Love this place.  I heard from several people how good it was and I was not disappointed! I had the Sleek (awesome) on my first trip and it was so good!!! Second trip I brought my husband, we started with the Mazza Platter.  Really great way to start!  Then I had Spinach Pie and my husband had the Filet.  Very, very good. Our food was packed with flavor.  Service was excellent, very friendly staff, nice atmosphere.  Sangria is the best I've tasted in a long time!

1gur2Lvdfzy_TsnJNsAaBg.text: Love this place. Living in Cecil I feel lucky to have this place within 5 minutes of my home. In a suburb filled with wing joints, burger joints and chains it's a breath of fresh air. The atmosphere is quaint but comfortable and the wait staff is very friendly. Mazza Platter is a no-brainer for us as the Baba Ghannouj and Hummus are out of this world. I usually alternate between the filet and lamb and they're always spot on, cooked as ordered, and seasoned perfectly. My wife is stuck on the Moussaka and pretty much refuses to order anything else so that's a resounding endorsement from a picky eater. I don't make it in too often for breakfast but when we have an opportunity, their classics are tasty and good along with a few twists.

yzXHry4MVxtDx3bnPDL8Pw.text: Perfect place for Sunday morning brunch. Friendly staff and great food. Try the Tuscan omlette with gyro meat, it is awesome.

AX_WVoP_r4BlYi5TJz-Jvg.text: We are vegetarians and found the appetizers to be huge, delicious, and we did not need entrees at all.  Service was very fast and friendly.  Reasonable prices for the size of portions.

6BymuZkinRPbblOwN6PpLA.text: Food is incredible, staff is friendly and very helpful, an overall amazing dining experience. One of the BEST Lebanese meals I have ever had!

7CC2-SKrsddytF5LPZR2rg.text: After driving by this place for so many years , we finally stopped in . It was one of the best food ever had for a really long time , the place had a warm neighborhood feel to it . The hummus was excellent . The owner Rabih stopped by our table and made sure everything was ok he even gave us a complementary baklawa it was awesome . We will definitely be back soon .

imWS9zd1Y-BlBYK5ioQF2w.text: Good food and great service! I arrived just a few minutes before they closed for the day, but the folks at Shouf's were very gracious in making my order and even giving me a free latte and some extra pita bread to go with my entree. Warm, friendly service from some very nice people. I highly recommend this place.

j-a5bw7Au8JTtaeYpMhAxQ.text: My wife and I dined here for the first time on 29 October 2013.  The restaurant is spacious and there are two rooms in which one may dine. The soundproofing is apparent excellent; one does not hear the Washington Avenue traffic that is a constant presence within twenty feet of the dining room. This is a congested area, but a complimentary parking lot is offered for customers in the rear of the building.  Although there was only one party there when we arrived and many four-tables available in both rooms, we were placed near the party at a tiny table for two.  We were not asked where we wanted to sit or whether the table at which we were seated was acceptable to us. Halfway through our meal, the staff decided to seat a party of six, which included young children, two feet from us, the end of any chance for intimate conversation. The highlight of our meal was the outstanding service from Franny.  She was unfailingly gracious, attentive, and efficient, never without a broad smile.  There is a whopping $10 corking fee for those foolish enough to bring their own wine, the message apparently being, "Do not do it." I found it odd that the restaurant did not have any Heineken bottled beer, which is on the menu.  A Lebanese beer substitute ($4.50 per bottle) was not an adequate substitute and did not have much flavor.  My wife's dirty martini was $9, quite pricey for the size of it.  The website mentions a "juicy burger", but there is nothing like it on the fairly small menu.  Our falafel appetizer with yogurt dipping sauce was tasty and an ample portion, but the balls somewhat dry.  The bread that was served with the appetizer was dry, shriveled, and tasteless. My gyro salad entree with french fries was good, though the meat not juicy.  The salad, like the salad which accompanies entrees, was predominantly iceberg lettuce, but there was enough meat and fries in my dish to satisfy, and it was fairly priced at $10.95. My wife enjoyed her moussaka.  If a customer has any comments about Shouf's, whether positive or constructive criticism, regarding Shouf's, you would best be advised not not to waste your time in submitting them.  The owners are not interested.  You can expect to be ignored.  I will take my business where it is valued.

oksDjkF6ALgXiZACLmUooA.text: I previously left a review about my first visit. Months later, we went again and Rabih genuinely remembered us. Then he sent us home with extra goodies yet again! Talk about making your customers feel special!!

CPxLE_FNHR270Ao6KoUXuA.text: I decided to try Shouf's and purchased a Groupon deal. My husband and I stoped by for dinner a few weekends ago. This small restaurant/coffee shop has a few tables by the bar and a few more in an ajoining room. It has a casual, homey feel. The wait staff were nice but became distracted when someone they knew came in to talk and eat. I ordered the filet while my husband ordered the chicken shish tawook. Both entrees came with a salad with their homemade dressing. I was a little disappointed with the salad because it was made with pale looking iceberg with a tomato wedge and an olive. The salad also comes with feta but I opted out. Their homemade dressing is quite tangy and not for you if you prefer bland flavors. (I loved it though my husband ws not a fan) Our dinners were served with their pita bread.The filet was presented in cubes over rice pilaf with a large stewed tomato in the middle. The filet was average. It was cooked as ordered and was tender but I was looking for more Lebanese flavoring, or any flavoring for that matter. The rice pilaf was also rather bland. On the other hand, my husband's chicken was juicy and delicious. I ended up sharing most of his meal. I gave Shouf's 3 stars because I didn't feel like they were consistent. Some items were delicious while others lacked flavor. I also thought it was a bit pricey for what you get. Tweny dollars for about 4-5 ounces of filet over rice with an iceberg lettece salad seems a little high. With some minor changes, Shouf's could easily make the impovements needed o bring customers (like me) back in the door.

GDtLPYEZSZal2kH4Wc7MPw.text: I found Shoufs because of a groupon and have been returning ever since. It is a quaint and pleasant family owned restaurant with fabulous food! They also recently started serving alcohol which is great because the humans pita and mujudarah go great with a glass of wine! Go with a group the portions make this food perfect for sharing!

ELtRdumBfQ4ny5OY4DYOEw.text: Great food and outstanding service.   Best lamb chops in the city and a generous salad.  The owner stopped at our table and very personable.  Don't miss this little gem.

BZRXAkMJRScrhHCgk4oQ2g.text: We had the most amazing New Year's Eve Dinner at Shoufs. The food and service was incredible.  We can't wait to go back.

vpMKV4oNMAx-T94HB11zwg.text: Excellent grape leaves, baba gnoush, and gyros! Our waitress said they have raw kibbe on Saturdays starting at 5 pm -- am hoping to get there soon to try it.

-BkMSk2Wsi72S-JCtXIrkw.text: I love this place. The staff is the best and always go out of their way to make sure you are happy. I always get the hummus and baba. It is reliably delicious. Next, I don't know what exactly is in the dressing for the salads, but it is perfectly mixed and is just refreshingly good. I suggest getting any lamb dish. My husband gets the shish tawook just about every time he goes there.  You cannot go wrong here. It's like going over to eat a family dinner. We go here for the people and the food.

wDoRi1RsuzqYc72KiPz1ow.text: Unique food choices you cannot find around here,  staff is very friendly. They made us feel right at home our first time there.

i_269PcwXmfrDzZLlMCT-g.text: I've eaten here several times since moving to Bridgeville last year. Everything I have tried has been delicious! They offer take out and it travels well. My faves are the grilled tomatoes and falafel. My siblings and I took our parents there for mother's day and we ate practically everything on the menu...tons of food and it didn't break the bank! I suggest this place to anyone who asks about a good restaurant. ..great staff and great food...can't ask for more!

f7ZYqc07gy74PBVP4YnZwg.text: Friendly service.  Nice little place with wood panel on the walls.  Enjoyed a variety of things including the Mazza Platter.  The mummus, tabbouli were good but the baba ghannouj just tasted like smoke.  The Gyro was good, thicker cuts of meat instead of the thin sliced.  The meal took a little longer than we expected.  It is BYOB, did not bring any in but the menu said, "BYOB $10 per bottle."  WOW is that expensive!  Do not understand charging that much.  Did notice a liquor license application in the window.

odJO3xk8hLMN8qDd95jvfQ.text: After having a horrible experience at another restaurant down the street this morning, I stumbled upon Shouf's as a second chance at breakfast. Not only is the service top notch, but the food is amazing. I got the Hushwee & Eggs and they were very adaptable to my food intolerances. My mother and I received our food within 15 minutes of ordering and our waitress was the greatest. I most definitely will be returning.

Ht_N055jdstc7EGZY1YPTQ.text: We finally made it back to Shouf's and were not disappointed! All the appetizers are fresh and delicious. My favorite meal there is the pork shank, but since the wife and I have been on a "4-Hour Body", slow carb diet, we steered away from anything with grains (the pork shank comes over rice).  This lead me to get the Gyro salad and Kelly to get her favorite, chicken salad. She actually loves that chicken salad so much that when she was pregnant I use to go pick it up and bring it home multiple times per week!  They gyro salad was awesome too. This is the first I've had it, and normally I would expect a gryo salad to be made with thin sliced meat (like a gyro). At Shouf's, the meat is thicker, and cooked perfectly. It's a bit crisp on the outside and cooker perfectly through the center.   We're looking forward to getting back soon!

hNNMukBJ2y_BYzsOQVpg3w.text: Excellent! We randomly found this wonderful little restaurant. The hummus and pita is quite flavorful. I had the Shouf Lebanese salad. Fantastic! My husband had a merlot and something that tastes divine. Wish I could remember the name. The baklava was divine!!!!

WKSGFOa5Emza8Ot7qvx5Pw.text: Awesome restaurant. Authentic lebanese. We got the grape leaves and family platter. So much food and worth every penny. Hummus was wonderful..the staff was so friendly and attentive. We will be back for sure!

YYXXGqoj7SHxfidP2P73Mw.text: The best food in Pittsburgh hands down.. We had the Maza platter and It was delicious then I had lamb dinner as my meal oh my the lamb was so tender and flavorful .

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Kafta dinner was so flavorful.

PhrLXxocWoytnqe-5-M6jA.text: About as close as my mom makes as it gets. I'm second generation Lebanese, my parents immigrated here 45 years ago. I'm here on business and found this place on yelp. You cannot go wrong. I'm both impressed with the authenticity of the food and the quality of service. Food was served fresh, hot, and on time. I ordered the cabbage rolls, kibbee balls, tabouli, and hummus. This place is not to miss and nailed it on every category.  I will be back often as I'm from Detroit and I live in Ohio where can't find a good Middle Eastern restaurant to save my life. This place makes me miss home.

sZyfccl-82RCdLO2Ajpjqw.text: I thought the place was just okay.  I ordered the Gyro sandwich and felt that it had no taste.  Also ordered the spinach pie.  Tasted like it had been over microwaved.  The waitress was extremely pleasant .

049t5RX79DahcfE0Ta9N3Q.text: Went here for breakfast before an appointment I had in the area. The portions were HUGE, the food was fantastic, and the atmosphere and staff were charming. Can't wait to try this place for dinner!

WgXd1zoZP74ni8M4WNAODA.text: Wonderful place to eat. Food made of fresh ingredients. Very friendly personal. Meat prepared very nicely.

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Wedding soup
Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Lamb kebab appetizer

lgYJo_1pUMR9_6-_XtdX5Q.text: Second review. Tonight I had the pork shank, which was perfect!  Also,  their mint tea is fabulous,  not overwhelming at all.

jMnjfotEp8VEMrOxcZ_tFQ.text: Stopped in after work for some yummy baklava. The workers were very friendly and the restaurant was appealing and clean. I didn't have time for dinner but I will be revisiting soon with friends!

b3nJXQ0bymQzyXKlf4WehQ.text: Awesome Mediterranean dining! Love the baba ganoush, mujadra, lamb chops and the speciality cocktails. Love the owners, they make everyone feel so welcomed.

Nlf3QDl_CsDDyuw6EfBvgg.text: Intending on grabbing a quick cup of coffee and appetizer, my boyfriend and I stopped into Shouf's with no expectations. We took a seat at the bar and were immediately greeted by the staff, who were clearly Lebanese and some of the friendliest food & bev people I have come in contact with in a while. The babaganoush was fresh and very authentic and the baklava, let's just say I haven't had baklava that delicious since I was in Turkey. Our server was enthusiastic about the restaurant and really seemed to love their job and the employees. Can't wait to go back to see the belly dancing show on Friday nights!

juIVtlbmgnWU2soI_m5OzA.text: This place is a little slice of heaven!! A True family place. I love how just everyone who works treats you so nicely. We love their breakfast food, it's got to be the best in Pittsburgh if not the state! But we have also started trying their lunch and dinner food and it is just as great!! I can't think of anything wrong with the whole experience at shoufs, it really is the best!

24PIX9grXsiqA1kT4kDkmw.text: Amazing lamp shank, we had moussaka, and falafel. All we great dishes!!! Staff is super friendly. Love the Arabic music. Very authentic!

7f9XlcFhvFVyZyla6236iQ.text: This is a cute little place tucked away in a cozy part of Bridgeville with excellent Lebanese food. I had the Kibbee Dinner which came with rice and a tomato-based sauce. It was served kind of like a meatloaf instead of in the acorn shape and was really good. Also devoured was their excellent falafel as an app and a slice of their "death by chocolate" cake wich was decadent. There was so much food, I took half of it home, the kibbee really holding up well the next day for lunch. Our server Cathy was a hoot. Jeopardy and Wheel of Fortune were one, and she played along with us, talking about old game shows and stuff. Cool restaurant.

9W6K6V8K2y1KCIrixSATRg.text: The folks here are always welcoming and the service is attentive. They have many unique and tasty breakfast selections, but their hot sausage is always the favorite part of my meal. That being said, I have never been disappointed in any of the several selections I have tried.

WCdFi6KS_RYwh17kZz3odw.text: This restaurant is very easy to find on Washington Pike in Bridgeville. Their baked Kibbeh is delicious as well as their baklava. It's got a small seating area but it's very well worth it!!!

McgebZ4Z5X59Rwz69VE9NA.text: Famished after spending the morning of Black Friday at the USC Rec Center pool, we decided to head to Shouf's after passing it a number of times going through Bridgeville.  We ordered the mazza platter and the hummus, baba ghannouj and tabbouli were fantastic.  I'm a huge fan of baba ghannouj and was a bit surprised to see how smooth theirs was, the baba that I've had has always been a bit chunky.  But chunky or not, it was delicious.  The hummus was also seasoned perfectly. I often get disappointed by the lack of flavor in hummus when I'm at restaurants but you could taste the lemon and the freshness of the chick peas.    I got the grape leaves as my main dish and they were heavenly.  Steamed hot just like I like them and flavorful.  My husband got the lamb kabob and meat pie and devoured them both!  I tried a piece of the lamb and although I'm not much of a lamb fan, I will admit this was gooood!  I wasn't a big fan of the meat pie after having a bite, but like I said the husband loved it.    Also ordered a piece of their baklava and it was perfect.  I'm not a huge fan of overly sugar/honey soaked baklava and this was crispy on top with a healthy amount of nut filling with the sugar soaked on the bottom portion of the pastry dough - YUM!    I'll definitely be back again!

c7D2gBJ_cNNcahpobPtVKQ.text: Mixed review. fair items included the sleek (watery, should have Kale imo) Moussaka, (over cooked, covered in paprika?) Good items included the tabbouleh, hummus (above average) feta, Muddjarah (yummy crispy onions on top, rest of it was a bit dry) baklava,  Memorable: the Baba ganush  Place was also way to noisy! but I will return

pz9NIgqMEzMq7-juZhddTw.text: "This is somethin' outta 'The Flintstones,'" our affable server Cathy told me as she trotted out Shouf's Lamb Shank, a brontosaurus leg of a protein serving slathered with a gravy of a reddish-orange hue and hunks of cauterized tomato on a bed of rice. Stripping the meat from the white bone required no exertion, and chewing it was almost unnecessary due to its fall-apart composition. The lamb itself was suety, slippery, and when coated with the tart, luscious sauce, approached a lamb curry, especially with the addition of cinnamon which made it close to mystical, mythical. I felt like the knight who had slain a dragon and was partaking in a grand, celebratory feast as a reward. An appetizer of falafel began the proceedings. The small bronze planets orbited a cup of a milky/silky tahini sauce that recalled tzatziki flatteringly, the Arabic hush puppies of chickpea plucking chords of crispness and moisture. Shouf's signature Lebanese Salad came between starter and entrees and was comprised of freshly shredded feta that resembled fallen snow which topped iceberg lettuce (how appropriate), cucumber, tomato, olives, and a lemony house dressing. Despite the acidic ingredients, it was never overly tart and served to wash my palate clean for what was to come. Dessert was an onyx monolithic cut of chocolate cake. Blacker than a starless night, chocolate shavings laid about its exterior like shingles. It was served cold like revenge often is, its darkness recalling deep space, where no cries for mercy can be detected... youtube.com/watch?v=6hFC... The baked batter was sodden with liquid chocolate, ganache mortaring this hellhouse on a plate. Only holy water could expel the evil spirits from my throat before the depravity choked me to death. And before we realized dinner was over, it was. Kay had her meal doggy-bagged, Cathy chatting with us as we watched "Wheel of Fortune" on the telly, discussing favorite game shows both past and present. Shouf's sits in a peaceful, modest suburb that I fear many Pittsburgh Yelpers will avoid since it's miles away from the buzz of the urban restaurant scene. It would be a crime for any diner to forsake their simple, pleasurable ethnic menu for more trendy eateries in the city's hub. Make the jaunt to Bridgeville, a land of milk carton-shaped homes that is a miniature railroad village made large and real, and allow yourself to be cosseted by Shouf's rustic, sincere, cherishable cuisine. You are overdue for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. A shot of the exterior that faces Washington Avenue as we were leaving
Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. &#34;Death by Chocolate&#34; Cake
Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Braised Lamb Shank

U_jiu5bjF7dm8lhR4XnLWw.text: Best food in Pittsburgh. My family and I always eat their especially for breakfast. I recently had them catter my niece's graduation party. They put a perfect menu for us and took all my stress away. Everyone at the party was so impressed of how delicious everything was. We were all very pleased with the food and service . Can't thank them enough for making it a perfect party for us.

3UQA7uBbSTTcuT0Jvoxx0A.text: One of the most amazing Lebanese restaurants in the Pittsburgh area. They always have wonderful service with food to match. It's as authentic as you can get without being out of the country. The cocktail menu is also something to behold. I recommend this establishment to anyone.. even someone who is hesitant to try mediterranean cuisine.

2cwutT1qfybA9p-9aW2b5Q.text: Some of the best Lebanese food I've ever had. This is one of my favorites in all of Pittsburgh! Had Shouf's cater a birthday party and they really outdid themselves...very reasonable price, not a single person left hungry and we still had a ton left over. Everyone raved about the food. Highly recommended for catering or any night out to eat!

Snva9yufh1uk1BwVEHFdFw.text: I have to start by saying the portions here are AWESOMELY generous. My colleague and I each ordered two appetizers at lunch, and it also became my dinner... and lunch again the next day. Which is great, because it's also super delicious.   Between us, we had two meat pies, a hummus platter, and the chicken rice (I can't recall the official name of the dish, but when I inevitably mispronounced it the waitress stage whispered that saying "rice with chicken" would suffice). All of it was great, it was ready quickly, and the service was friendly with frequent check-ins. The small space makes the restaurant feel cozy and intimate, but you don't feel crowded.   The highlight was our server taking the time to put our leftovers into four separate boxes PLUS a plastic-wrapped bundle of pita bread to complement the second (and third) meals. I'd say Shouf's is a bit of a hidden gem.

4gaLHTm8dUYIF0oZ7BDXaQ.text: Everything was outstanding from the appetizers to the desert. Had the grilled pork chop & chicken special. Fantastic!

nohrlwl-8XNbcnheWifd1w.text: Visited Shouf's for lunch today and was delighted at how quaint this restaurant is!   I've passed this restaurant plenty of times and never went in. I'm so glad I did this time. We started with the grape leaves and I had the gyro for the lunch. Both were excellent. The gyro had a slightly different cucumber sauce than I'm normally used to having, but it didn't detract from the meal at all. The gyro meat was also cubed, not sliced. I will definitely be back to keep trying the menu.   Service was excellent, very attentive and accommodating.   From what my lunch partners advised, it is their regular go to once a week in the area and I can definitely see why.

6rQDJIDQFU3Npq0UHnzL_A.text: Excellent drink menu.....the apple cobbler and caffe disarrono.   Rabhi the owner has a great sense of humor.   Excellent service and atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Love this place .

2Z6bkITtF7SnCO1_nZeJzA.text: We were so lucky to find this place. A few weeks ago our son Bought a car next door and we had lunch here. Our meal was great. Food was so fresh and well seasoned. Service was fast and friendly. We are from out of town.  Wish we were closer. We would eat here often. Great food and service. Thank you.

9gL7LuN9dndDQvO704smtw.text: This place has amazing Lebanese food at very good prices. I had the falafel wrap and it was fantastic! The people inside also have great personalities. Such a great place!

gNlrh1auYhDrDrRagq5tuQ.text: This is by far the best Lebanese food in Pittsburgh. We love coming here! The fattoush and tabbouli are always fresh and super flavorful (we have tried it at several different area restaurants and they are always lacking something.) Going to dinner there again tonight-can't wait!

wThrPYPJSzE7BidW8VTzbQ.text: Great little place!  The Family Feast was delicious, especially the lamb. Plenty of food for four. We took home lots of left overs. The service was prompt and very friendly!

lUIIn82JBGzvW-4kOANz-Q.text: I stopped by here a couple of Fridays agowith my fiance for dinner.  I had been wanting to try Shouf's for awhile and it did not disappoint.  As soon as we walked into the restaurant I was surprised by how small the place was.  Then our waitress took us over to a second dining area in an adjoining room where there was much more seating.  The restaurant had a comfortable feeling with lots of dark woods all around.  For dinner my fiance and I decided to start off by getting the baba ghanouj while I went with the Chicken Shish Tawook and she went with the gyro platter as our entrees.  The baba ghanouj came out first in a fairly large plate with pitas and ended up being pretty tasty.  It had quite a smoky flavor to it which I have never really noticed in a baba ghanouj before and if I was pressed to tell you that I was eating eggplant, there is no way that I would have been able to.  My fiance ended up liking it too and between the two of us we easily finished it off.  Next up were our "side" salads that came with the entrees.  They were absolutely enormous and consisted of iceberg lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, olives and were topped with a generous serving of fresh shredded feta cheese in addition to their homemade lemon/mint/garlic Lebanese dressing.  I have to admit that I really enjoyed the salads, especially the feta and dressing, and by the time that I had finished mine I could have went home happy and full.  Since we still had our entrees coming out next that wasn't to be.  My entree ended up consisting of cubes of chicken breast marinated in garlic and olive oil over a bed of Lebanese Rice.  The chicken proved to be moist and quite tasty although I wish there would have been some more color to the dish.  In the end I only made it about half way through my dish before asking for a box to take the rest home.  My fiance similarly did not make it too far into her gyro platter and so we both had enough for our lunch the next day.  The bottom line for me is that I would come back here again in the future.  I really enjoyed everything that we had here and I thought that the amount of food that we received was really good for the price.

n7f2zgqHpLlrz1lZHJKG1w.text: Excellent food!  Owners are fantastic!  Friendly,  clean,  nice bar,  good wine.  Love this place and would recommend to everyone!

wndnOLumgtcktM07-95dOg.text: I'm of Lebanese descent.  I grew up with Lebanese food.  Shouf's has the best Arabic food I've had in Pittsburgh.  Massive portions, affordable prices, and immense quality.  Get the Stuffed Grape Leaves, the Kibbee, etc.  The staff are extremely accommodating and friendly. I can't say enough good things.    However...I didn't enjoy the rice pudding.  It contains rosewater and tastes like a perfume (at least to me). I won't dock a star for this though, as it's only my personal preference.

CR2FRSk092laR9oteZJbfw.text: Great people running this place.  Amazing hummus and greek food with very generous portions. One of my go-tos....

y2ELRdWZ-GJPi8Bo7JABwg.text: I LOVE Mediterranean food! I went to this place one time, and the next day, I noticed that I had been double-charged on my card.  I went back to the restaurant and showed the owner that I had been charged twice (after verifying with my bank), and the man REFUSED to refund one of the charges. Not a big deal, because I disputed the charge and got the $ back, but bad business ethics.  I won't go back.

r2xgD3uBoUYNAPmPo0f47A.text: Great food and service. Food tastes homemade. And super clean. Best baklava ever. Family and kids friendly.

BkYn6t2LzMvvZFiB1E99Ug.text: Incredible  Must go!  Seriously, this is the closest that I have found to my own homemade food. I found this little gem on Yelp and I am so glad that I did!  It will be my new favorite place to frequent!  Our server was fantastic, she made recommendations to us since we've never been there before, she also made sure we didn't order too much for the two of us...which some servers do to run up a check. I am glad we stuck to all starters so that we got to sample several menu items.  The grapeleaves were perfect, I prefer a little more lemon- but that is just my personal preference (they do serve with a lemon wedge..but for me the more the better). The spinach pie was on point, the dough was excellent and the spinach filling was delicious! We wish the meat pie had the same dough...will pass on that next time.  Kibbee was phenomenal. I'm not a fan of lamb in my kibbee, but this was incredible and I couldn't tell the difference.  Pine nuts are a plus!  The hummus....was better than mine...I'm serious...so good   I Can't wait to go back!

89lBs1phg11Qr8IrjqzK1g.text: Absolutely love this restaurant! First time visiting, we were greeted with friendly smiles and an enthusiastic server. The food was excellent - my boyfriend and I took the advice from other reviews and shared an appetizer and entree (wanted to leave room for dessert!). We got the hummus & pita as well as a gyro platter. Both items were delicious and generously portioned. I'm a huge fan of the rice - not sure what is in it, but is so fragrant and tasty!! The hummus was super fresh and creamy as well, pairing super well with the gyro platter. We ended the meal with two desserts (baklava and chocolate cake) and two dessert drinks. Both desserts were very fresh and tasty, and the drinks were very well made. Although we lost track of time and accidentally cut it kind of close to the restaurant's closing time, we were not rushed and were seen out with friendly "goodbye"s and "come again"s from all of the employees! Looking forward to future visits!

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Gyro Platter! Gyro meats on a bed of rice with a grilled tomato.
Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Spanish Coffee - great dessert drink to finish off the meal!

5yQEs9mycyc7hXLwa-mx-A.text: The food, service, everything is fantastic here. We love the warmth everytime we step in the door.  It's a tad expensive but well worth it. You will never go home hungry.

1fQLFY29UBAK3uJu9kVXTw.text: This place!!!! So good! Nice staff and excellent food. I don't know where to start. I LOVE authentic food that is hearty and just makes you feel good after eating. This place does the trick EVERY single time. We sit at the bar and hang with the bartender, who is pleasant and SUPER NICE. She can also give food and dessert advice.  My husband and I typically split a dinner because we learned the hard way they have large wonderful portions we could split and both be full.  Dessert MUST: Smurtle - turtle and s'more.  A lady makes these turtle marshmallow things in her home and they are tiny bites of deliciousness.  Kafta dinner - good enough to split for 2.  My husband and I always split this.  Their rice - not sure what's in it - is delicous and smells so good!  I've come here like 3-4 times and always get the same thing because it is that yummy.  It tastes like a home cooked meal.   I have yet to come with the belly dancer, but they told me that if you follow them on Facebook then they'll post when she comes.  I've seen belly dancers at other mediterranean restaurants in Houston and it is an experience.  I'd also say it's interesting for the entire family.

1pxFFTOfNvDg-7NRXNvN6g.text: Wonderful experience today. The staff could not have been nicer. Went above and beyond to make it a great experience. The food was wonderful, humus best ever and grape leaves were exceptional. The baklava was delicious. Will be going back again.

2bPAA641Spls0cM9r3pwQQ.text: Great atmosphere. Really good Lebanese-style food. Fresh and quick. But, above all, a warm loving staff that really radiates a positive energy which permeates the space. First time eating here but, when I'm in the area, I'll be back!

MGfHrrQ-deKTcL_I_KMvwQ.text: The lamb.....love this place!  The staff is excellent and nice.  Delicious!  One of my favorites.

txhbqRjQ5Q2jXLuSpv0Wuw.text: Good stuff! Service was attentive and quick.  The baba was a big portion and delicious. Very smooth.  The meat pie and spinach pies both had good flavor, but I had hoped for a flaky crust. Both felt like a calzone with a doughy crust. Not bad, I still really enjoyed them -- I think that more of a filo dough would have made it even better.  Falafel wrap was huge and tasty!

7kxPEFZkoFhhTFzMGS_WpA.text: Shouf's is hands down, just great. The family owned and operated restaurant always has available seating and their menu items are downright delicious. My mom and I come here on a regular basis and always have a wonderful experience. I hope they never close!

dGG9tXFyYyavjftjjgIXOQ.text: I like this place. The people are friendly and the food is good. The hummus and baba are the best in the south hills.  It's small so you might need to wait for a table but it's worth it.  Try the chicken for the entree or the gyro. Both are very good. For dessert the baklava is really good!

FAczvoFUvqFQoLpeDqqXtQ.text: Their grape leaves are homemade and HUGE! The tabouli is to die for and of course the shish kebob and rice is yummy but I do like mine with a side of red sauce. The staff is always very friendly and professional. The takeout is prompt and painless. They're probably the only restaurant around that offer traditional heshwee for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Fresh and homemade with quality ingredients.

ZhhbauI9G36bIcDhL36lig.text: This place is awesome.  Make sure that you pack an appetite because everything I ate was awesome.   The hummus tasted great, the stuffed grape leaves were great.  I  ordered the grilled Pork & Chicken special.   Both the Pork & Chicken was cooked perfectly,  both were tender and moist.   The BBQ sauce was sweet with a hint of heat.  I  will for sure come back here.

ez5iMvo7YMRWdsskJ7MLdA.text: Once again, another wonderful meal at Shouf's! Dave wasn't particularly hungry, so we started off with their amazing baba ghanouj (by far, the best, anywhere around here) and pita points, and he had the stuffed grape leaves as his entree, and I had the loobyeh, a tasty mix of sauteed green beans, tomatoes and spices. Served with a large portion of rice, it was delicious, and one of my favorites, here. The staff are always friendly and accommodating, and it's worth fighting the Bridgeville traffic to eat!

8jdqbraombQ13A_rOdvNzw.text: My family and I are from the Bay Area and we've found so many highly recommended restaurants in Pittsburgh subpar, this was not one of them. The food was fresh, the flavors on point, the service excellent. My only complaint, the servings were twice as big as necessary. I found myself telling my wife that I would have paid the same amount for half of the food.    I saved this review mid-writing, since starting this we've been back numerous times. We've had way too many dishes to list but needless to say, we did not have a bad one in the bunch.

C5Sx-RioBgFHV003CNe3jA.text: Outstanding middle eastern food. The lamb is moist and delicious, either in the chops or on a salad. The baba ganoush is my favorite outside of the middle East, and the grape leaves are one of my favorites. The grape leaves are seasoned perfectly and come warm. Huge portions and special family rum atmosphere!

ooYPJOyh67rTlGH6xOEYHg.text: Very unprofessional , and the food is sub-par.  I really had no expectations, so being disappointed was no surprise.  The management I found extremely aloof and disrespectful.  Not just to us patrons, but to other subordinates in the restaurant. Clearly we will never return, but we will be sure to spread the word so that others know before going.

iA5NCXtqMZYEVebd9mdNlg.text: Went for breakfast, maybe it would have tasted  better if the food was served hot. I think it sat for a while before it was served. Everything was cold, the eggs, the toast, and the potatoes. In reading the breakfast choices, everything looked good, but today they didn't deliver. The service was decent, the owner/host was very friendly when greeting us upon arrival and thanking us when we left. I look at the other good reviews, maybe it was a bad day or breakfast is not their strong suit. I would be willing to try them again as I like patronizing local independently owned businesses.

bwMwl_xI7W20ngxNqU-EeQ.text: The parking lot is small... the cafe is amazing!  My husband and I stopped by for breakfast and enjoyed their breakfast specials.  It's definitely worth your money and our server was amazing.  It was clear that everyone else there on Sunday morning was a local because the servers/staff and owner (it seemed) asked the patrons about whatever and they all played catch up.  At the end of our breakfast, a patron known by name asked me if I had been there before.  When I replied no, she was surprised.  At checkout my server gave me a complimentary Baklava which tasted amazing!  5 stars for sure.

6vA6He3Z_8pFrYOBJZcuRw.text: What a cute place!  I was able to bring my pup  and sit outside on a beautiful morning.  They brought out a little dish of water for him too.    Had the patio all to myself but there were lots of customers coming in and out.  I got the Hushwee and Eggs- delicious!  I was hoping for more fun coffee  options.... but first world problems, amiright?   I got some baba ghanoush with a hefty side of fresh pita.  Had a quick taste before leaving- it's nice and smooth and so yummy!  The waitress was really sweet, the flowers were beautiful, and the food was on point.  Not much more you can ask for!  Definitely highly recommend, especially if you're looking for something a bit different from the standard American breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States
Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States

JZylsAsLHBvfPyUwCyKnTg.text: Amazing! Service A+. Food A+. Atmosphere A+.   If you like Mediterranean Food, please give this a shot. 4 of us and ordered the Family Feast. It was perfect. All of the food was fresh and cooked perfectly.   Topped it off with homemade Baclava. Off the charts!  Some of these Mediterranean places have become so hipster that you can't enter unless know every Mumford & Sons song. All are welcome here, whether you are a legit foodie or a gyro every now and then kind of person.   We will be back!  Lastly...the people are so kind who work here. You can't help but want to support their passion.

ZeGVS-U_4KxdZIbPVT0a3Q.text: If you put lamb on your menu, I will most likely find your restaurant. I guess I have a thing for lamb! Who knew...  And I love Mediterranean food. So I'm not shocked that I found Shouf's. I had intended on going elsewhere, only to find that they had been flooded in the recent months, and had to rebuild. Fortunately for me, Shouf's was around the corner and - bonus - had lamb kofta on special that day. It was served as a wrap with a side of chips. Very well done! I don't usually indulge in dessert over lunch, but the baklava was sitting there screaming my name, and I went for it. Do yourself the same favor, and try it. The staff was very friendly and attentive, and place looked spotless. I highly recommend this place.

qQIBb1i8_f_AZIJd3AlEkA.text: Yum! I loved the food and the atmosphere! Friendly people too!   I wasn't starving so ordered the appetizer that included hummus, baba ganoush, etc. It was delicious and filled me up! I had enough for lunch the next day!

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States

EutcERJtAC3PQMKz1vQlDw.text: (BREAKFAST REVIEW)  Basic, and I mean very basic menu. I would give two stars, but have been here for dinner and was impressed in the past.  The breakfast I chose could have easily been from anywhere else, to be honest I was kind of disappointed Shouf's didn't have a more diverse menu. Diner food more or less.   Pancakes were pretty dried out, and hardly had any chocolate chips in them.  Also, is there alcohol here for brunch? I would have LOVED a bloody Mary, or a mimosa but no one even presented me with the idea.

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States

X4_NxVQ7YeJkDmAVbrGblQ.text: Great dinner.  The lamb kabobs were cooked perfectly.  Hummus and baba ghanoush done right.

34GdtfCuA0h_D4XqvOHb5w.text: I have been here quite a few times over the years, and I have always enjoyed eating here, whether solo for a quick lunch (they have daily lunch specials), or spending time with family, or a group of friends.  They do have a wide variety of Lebanese dishes on the lunch and dinner menus, and also desserts (Baklava, Rice Pudding, Cake), plus a fully-stocked bar (For something different, try the Almaza beer, imported from Lebanon).  The Mazza plate is fantastic, and has a nice sampling of appetizers (If you are really hungry, and up for a challenge, you could try to eat this as a whole meal by yourself).  Breakfast on the weekends is good, but it is mostly American style offerings.  I would like to see more Levantine dishes available on the breakfast menu (the Eggs Hushwee are the closest thing to Lebanese that they have for breakfast, and they are very good, but if you ask nicely, you can get some other items that are not listed for breakfast, such as Hummus, Baba Ghanoush, and Mjuddara).  I really wished they had Ful (Foul) Medames on the breakfast menu (hint, hint).  The service is very good, the owner and staff have always been very pleasant, and I look forward to visiting again . . . Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Breakfast menu on weekends ...
Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Mjuddara .... (not on the breakfast menu, but was available during breakfast today) ...
Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Baklava &amp; Coffee ...

NE_bWvPqNu4HWp4SUb8zkw.text: This is a cute Lebanese restaurant. The place is not very big but has a decent amount of tables. The food was very food and they give you plenty to eat. There's a wine and drink list.

gGmonFo3QvS6XfUyCZEBdQ.text: Good tasting Mediterranean food, lots of it, and great service!! It's like eating with family! Mezza platter and lamb kabobs hit the spot! I came for lunch and the service was attentive and friendly. This place is clean!

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Dessert? Yes please!

Ipbi-m2TjuIDDjm-o6ggQw.text: I was not really impressed with dinner here it was ok but not fantastic I have heard that they have a great breakfast but dinner was uninspired and bland

photos.caption: Photo of Shouf's Cafe - Bridgeville, PA, United States. With my new Granddaughter Edie

mCsHCX8ocjWuVwa52HOHqw.text: Wow. Moved here from Chicago years ago, now in the South Hills area. So greatfull  to find an authentic and reasonably priced Lebanese restaurant. Never disappoints and something for everyone. Kid friendly and awesome friendly staff!

nApxITMk9T_dMpof5nGFgA.text: Got the Mediterranean Chicken and stuffed grape leaves. Both were excellent.  Highly recommend this place.

7G7l3RFku5gbBV9I-UoAHg.text: We stopped here for brunch. Had tuna and chicken sandwich with fries. Very tasty food and clean place. Our waitress Denice, she was very nice! Brighten my day after visit to DMV office               --

KBrfuEzRI98WMhvespP9KA.text: We stopped for late lunch/early dinner. We received excellent service and excellent food. I ordered Loubieh, my wife a spinach pie and we split a Baba Ganoush. This is a rare restaurant where one can get good quality vegetarian fare without processed vegetable oil. I was very pleased.

kKMd7dN06EgVD_glwJ4WeA.text: I've come here twice from out of town (Houston) to take my mom out for a special meal. She loves lamb! The people at Shouf's are great and really helpful in explaining the menu selections. The food is fresh and the shared-servings salads and dips are large, with lots of pita to mop them up. You'll feel like you visited a nice family's place - because you have!

F5j68b7e6wZkJ20Zm6a_9w.text: Always a great time when I get a chance to stop into shoufs. I'm a big fan of the grape leaves and the gyro plate, but i have yet to be disappointed with a single dish

IDAesmuKwVCXTcqmGNLwvg.text: One of the few things I miss about living in Bridgeville is eating here on a regular basis. Their kebabs, spinach pies and tabbouleh are out of this world. My daughter and I would often split an entree as well as an appetizer because the food is so plentiful. Oh my and the grape leaves are out-of-this world.

KPBV6SVptEsjYuAzcutrfQ.text: Stopped to place a takeout order. The waitress explained some of the dishes and made some recommendations. I needed to go back to the car where my mother was waiting. The waitress volunteered to bring the food out to me. Best service ever!!  The food was spectacular. We had the most tender lamb, great green beans with tomatoes and tasty souvlaki. I will absolutely come back here again!!

YrDP4sCuCpEXxORkP7DgvA.text: Delicious Lebanese food!  Fattoush was on point, baked Kibee was perfect.  The pita's were done just right.  I will definitely be returning when in the area again.

hRg6w-bJ3_5uDU1gQnMNOg.text: Very good food but the prices are too high.  $8.95 for an iceberg salad?  $9.99 for chicken "kaboobs" that turned out to be 3 pieces of chicken on a plate and a slice of tomato with NOTHING else.  The food was good, there is no question about that, but it's hard to enjoy it when you feel like you're being gouged.  Go to Amel's - same food, better price.
